title: Aluminum Falls Amid Renewed US-China Tensions
summary: Aluminum prices fell due to renewed tensions between the US and China, particularly over rare earth export controls. Despite this, aluminum prices remain high, supported by strong market fundamentals. The price dropped to $2,740 per tonne.

title: Macro Tailwinds and Solid Fundamentals Support Aluminum Prices
summary: Aluminum prices are expected to hold up well in the short term due to macroeconomic tailwinds and solid market fundamentals. The SHFE aluminum contract showed a consolidating trend, fluctuating around 20,930 yuan/mt. Technical indicators suggest a bullish alignment.

title: Tightening Fundamentals and Inventory Drawdown to Boost Aluminum Prices
summary: Aluminum prices are likely to be boosted by tightening market fundamentals and inventory drawdowns. The most-traded SHFE aluminum contract closed at 20,920 yuan/mt, showing a fluctuating upward trend. Market sentiment remains cautious due to insufficient trading volume.

title: South32 Ltd (S32) Earnings: Alumina & Aluminum Production Increase as FY26 Guidance Holds
summary: South32 reported a 1.4% increase in alumina production to 1.29 million tons and a 0.6% rise in aluminum production to 311,000 tons in the first quarter. The company maintained its FY26 production guidance despite some fluctuations in other metal outputs. Production increases were supported by operations exceeding capacity and improved supply conditions, while negotiations for long-term electricity supply at Mozal Aluminium remain unresolved.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high of around $2,800 per tonne due to rising demand from clean energy sectors and supply constraints including China's power shortages and environmental regulations. New projects in Europe, Canada, and the Middle East are expected to increase low-carbon aluminum capacity by 3–4 million tons in 2025. Aluminum's role in decarbonization is growing, driven by its use in electric vehicles, renewable energy, and sustainable construction.

title: Steel Dynamics Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Steel Dynamics highlighted strong performance in its aluminum flat rolled products segment, with finished products for industrial, beverage can, and automotive sectors being qualified earlier than expected. The company is ramping up operations and expects stronger demand for aluminum flat rolled products heading into 2026. Additionally, Steel Dynamics produced its first biocarbon to lower carbon emissions in steel production.

title: The Department of Commerce Posts Second Tranche of Items for Potential Inclusion on Section 232 Steel and Aluminum Derivative Product Tariff Lists
summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce posted a second tranche of public requests for inclusion of additional steel and aluminum derivative products under Section 232 tariffs. The comment period for these potential tariff inclusions ends on October 21, 2025. This follows a June 2025 proclamation increasing tariffs on steel and aluminum derivative imports from 25% to 50%, except for the UK which remains at 25%.

title: South32 Production Guidance Steady Despite Share Slump
summary: South32 reaffirmed its FY26 production guidance across all operations, including aluminum, despite a nearly 10% share price decline this year. The company reported a 33% increase in manganese volumes and a 12% rise in payable copper equivalent production. CEO Graham Kerr emphasized the focus on maintaining momentum and capitalizing on strengthening base metals market conditions.

title: Aluminum's Low-Carbon Revolution in Action
summary: The global aluminum industry is undergoing a significant transformation with a focus on sustainability, innovation, and circular practices. Companies are adopting low-carbon production methods, renewable energy, and advanced recycling technologies. This shift is driven by changing environmental standards and market needs.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a three-year high due to increased demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. The industry is shifting towards low-carbon production, with new projects in Europe, Canada, and the Middle East expected to increase global capacity for low-carbon aluminum.

title: Aluminium's Real Paradox – Energy Use vs Carbon Saving
summary: The aluminum industry faces a paradox between energy use and carbon savings. Recycling is highlighted as a key solution, saving up to 95% of energy needed for primary aluminum production and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The global recycling rate was 76% in 2024.

title: Steel Dynamics Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Steel Dynamics reported a 30% increase in operating income for its steel operations in Q3 2025 due to record steel shipments and metal spread expansion, despite a $15 sequential decrease in average external product selling price to $1,119 per ton. Demand was strong in energy, non-residential construction, automotive, and industrial sectors, while scrap raw material costs declined more than steel selling values.

title: HRC Steel Price Falls Slightly on October 20, 2025
summary: Hot Rolled Coil (HRC) steel price fell to 812 USD/T on October 20, 2025, down 0.25% from the previous day and 2.05% over the past month, though still 15.18% higher than a year ago. Forecasts expect HRC steel prices to rise to 829.86 USD/T by the end of Q4 2025 and 893.93 USD/T within 12 months.

title: Steel prices in the third week of October 2025
summary: Global steel product prices showed slight fluctuations during the third week of October 2025, with some products recording limited increases, indicating a relatively stable market with minor price adjustments.

title: Germany lags behind in steel demand among industrialized countries
summary: German steelmakers reduced steel production by 11.9% year-over-year to 22.4 million tons in January-August 2025, reflecting weaker steel demand compared to other industrialized countries. Pig iron production also fell, signaling challenges in the German steel market.

title: Jin10 Futures Morning Report, October 21, 2025
summary: The report highlights global iron ore shipments from October 13 to October 19, 2025, which increased by 1.26 million tonnes from the previous week. China's crude steel production in September 2025 was 73.49 million tons, marking a year-on-year decrease of 4.6%. Additionally, coal mines in the Shanyin County area halted production temporarily.

title: Steel Pressured by Weak Demand
summary: Steel rebar futures remain low due to sluggish demand and narrowing margins. China's crude steel production in September was 73.49 million metric tons, down 4.6% from a year earlier. Only about 57% of Chinese steel mills were profitable by the end of September.

title: ASI Honours Sustainability Leaders
summary: The Australian Steel Institute's 2025 Steel Sustainability Awards recognized leading sustainability projects in the steel industry. Winners included the St Marys Integrated Project Office and Bradbury Park Playscape for their innovative and sustainable construction methods. These projects highlight the industry's focus on reducing waste and emissions.

title: Steel Tech 2025: The Event Where Steel, Technology, and Innovation Shape Its Future
summary: Steel Tech 2025, hosted at the Bilbao Exhibition Centre, will bring together industry leaders to discuss innovation and sustainability in the steel sector. The event focuses on carbon neutrality, AI, and global raw material strategies. It offers a platform for networking and business opportunities.

title: Innovative Upcycling of Aluminium Waste in Steel Production Shows Promising Results
summary: A recent innovation in upcycling aluminium waste for steel production has shown promising results. This development could enhance sustainability in the steel industry by reducing waste and improving resource efficiency.

title: LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, initially dropping to $10,601/mt before rising to a high of $10,714/mt and closing at $10,712.5/mt, up 0.99%. The SHFE copper contract also saw fluctuations, closing at 85,670 yuan/mt, up 0.48%. MMG reported copper losses of about 90,000 mt due to illegal mining at its Las Bambas mine.

title: Copper Price Approaches Record on US-China Trade Uncertainty
summary: Copper prices neared records due to uncertainty surrounding US-China trade talks and global supply disruptions. Prices reached as high as $10,691.50 per tonne in London and $5.0485 per lb. on the Comex. The market remains bullish amid mine disruptions and supply issues.

title: Copper Demand to Rise 24% to 43 MTPA, Tightening Supply: Report
summary: A report by Wood Mackenzie forecasts copper demand to increase by 24% to 42.7 million tons per annum, driven by global economic development and electrification. Factors like electric vehicles and industrialization in Asia are expected to significantly boost demand.

title: Copper Ticks Higher on Strong China Industrial Data; Plenum in Focus
summary: Copper prices rose following strong industrial data from China. Investors are also focusing on upcoming political events in China, which could impact market trends.

title: BHP starts FY strong as copper and iron-ore output lift in tightening markets
summary: BHP reported a 4% increase in group copper production, driven by record concentrator throughput at the Escondida mine. This production boost comes amid tightening markets for copper and iron ore.

title: Copper Demand to Rise 24% to 43 MTPA, Tightening Supply: Report
summary: A Wood Mackenzie report forecasts copper demand to increase by 24% to 42.7 million tons per annum by 2035, driven by factors such as electric vehicles, renewable energy, AI data centers, and industrialization in India and Southeast Asia. The report highlights supply tightening amid rising demand.

title: Arizona Sonoran soars on new copper ranking
summary: Arizona Sonoran Copper's shares hit a historic high after releasing a pre-feasibility study showing its Cactus project could become the third largest cathode copper producer in the U.S. The project is expected to produce about 103,000 tonnes annually over the first 10 years with strong economic metrics.

title: Solis Minerals to Acquire Cucho Copper Project in Peru
summary: Solis Minerals announced a binding agreement to acquire up to 75% interest in the Cucho Copper Project in Peru, a large-scale copper-molybdenum-silver porphyry system. The project has significant historical drilling data and potential for a major resource, with plans for exploration drilling in early 2026.

title: Tartana Minerals Returns Strong Copper-Gold Assays from Exploration at Muscleville Project in FNQ
summary: Tartana Minerals reported strong copper and gold assay results from its Muscleville prospect in Queensland, Australia. The results confirm mineralization in new zones near the existing open pit, supporting future drilling targets and exploration potential.

title: BHP Resolution Copper Mine: 7 Innovations For 2025
summary: The article details seven major technological and sustainability innovations at BHP's Resolution Copper Mine, including automated drilling, advanced ore processing, intelligent mine management, water recycling, sustainable land reclamation, renewable energy integration, and community engagement. These innovations are projected to significantly reduce CO2 emissions, increase efficiency, and boost annual copper output, setting a benchmark for sustainable copper mining.

title: Anaconda Copper Mine 2025: Innovations & Sustainability
summary: This piece highlights the Anaconda Copper Mine as a case study in sustainable mining, emphasizing the adoption of AI, digital monitoring, eco-rehabilitation, and automation. It underscores the importance of transparency, carbon monitoring, and community engagement in shaping the future of responsible copper extraction.

title: Sandvik Mining Equipment Demand Drives Record Industry Growth
summary: The article reports on surging global demand for Sandvik mining equipment, driven by the energy transition, infrastructure development, and stricter environmental regulations. It notes that copper and other critical minerals are central to this growth, with mining companies upgrading equipment for greater efficiency and lower emissions.

title: The global copper conundrum
summary: This analysis discusses concerns over the long-term sustainability of copper supply, citing an imbalance between merger and acquisition activity and the discovery of new copper deposits. It raises questions about whether current innovation and investment levels can meet future demand amid tightening supply.

title: On October 21, the price of SMM #1 refined nickel was 121,100-123,900 yuan/mt, with an average price of 122,500 yuan/mt, up 400 yuan/mt from the previous
summary: Nickel prices edged up slightly on October 21, with the average price of SMM #1 refined nickel rising by 400 yuan/mt to 122,500 yuan/mt. This reflects a modest increase in the nickel market on that day.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices edged up slightly on October 21 while China's GDP in the first three quarters rose 5.2% YoY
summary: Nickel prices showed a slight increase on October 21, with the average price of SMM #1 refined nickel at 122,500 yuan/mt, up 400 yuan/mt from the previous day. The report also notes China's GDP growth of 5.2% year-over-year for the first three quarters of 2025, which may influence market sentiment.

title: Jin10 Futures Morning Report, October 21, 2025 (Tuesday)
summary: The report covers broader commodity trends including iron ore shipments and steel production in China, with no direct update on nickel prices. However, it provides context on raw material supply and demand which can impact nickel market trends.

title: Nickel Rises, But Sentiment Bearish on Strong Supply -- Market Talk
summary: Nickel prices edged higher with the three-month LME contract rising slightly. Indonesia has increased efforts to address safety and environmental issues in nickel mining by revoking permits and suspending companies, which has eased concerns about overexpansion but market sentiment remains bearish due to expectations of strong Indonesian nickel supply continuing.

title: Talon Metals Receives Extension From Kennecott Exploration To Ensure Alignment Of The Tamarack Nickel Copper Projects Feasibility Study With Environmental Review
summary: Talon Metals secured a 12-month extension to deliver a feasibility study and make a payment to Kennecott Exploration, moving the deadline to March 14, 2027. This extension aligns the feasibility study with environmental review processes for the Tamarack Nickel Copper Project in Minnesota, aiming to develop a high-grade nickel-copper mine while meeting rigorous environmental standards.

title: Bunker Hill Provides October Project Update
summary: Bunker Hill Mining Corp. reported substantial progress toward restarting the Bunker Hill Mine in Idaho, targeting the first half of 2026 for restart. The company highlighted advances in project development including filter press concrete foundations and processing plant installations, supporting efforts to strengthen the US metals supply chain with nickel among key metals.

title: Metallurgical Machinery October 2025 Atomized Nickel Powder Procurement
summary: Ansteel Group Zhongyuan Industrial Development Co., Ltd. is proceeding with an open single-round negotiation for procurement of atomized nickel powder. The project requires bidders to meet specific business license and capital requirements, indicating ongoing industrial demand and procurement activity in nickel powder production.

title: On October 21, the price of SMM #1 refined nickel was up
summary: The price of SMM #1 refined nickel increased by 400 yuan/mt to an average of 122,500 yuan/mt, reflecting a short-term price rise in refined nickel on October 21, 2025.

title: Nickel nanowires in plasma-treated nanotubes boost hydrogen production and wastewater purification
summary: Skoltech researchers have developed a durable nickel-based catalyst using nanowires embedded in nitrogen plasma-treated carbon nanotubes, which significantly enhances hydrogen production from urea in wastewater while resisting degradation in harsh alkaline environments. This innovation could lead to more efficient and long-lasting electrolyzers for clean hydrogen fuel, simultaneously aiding wastewater treatment.

title: Sofi Prima to Enhance Nickel Sulphate Production at Battery Chemicals Plant
summary: Sofi Filtration has delivered its Sofi Prima ultra-sound self-cleaning filtration system to Terrafame's battery chemicals plant in Finland, aiming to improve the purity of nickel sulphate production. The technology captures ultra-fine particles without chemicals or disposable filters, reducing maintenance, water usage, and operational costs while supporting sustainable industrial processes.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali transaction closing: Walsin Lihwa Corporation at 70% of capital
summary: Walsin Lihwa Corporation has become the majority shareholder of Cogne Acciai Speciali with a 70% stake, while the Marzorati family retains 30%. Yu-Lon Chiao will succeed Eng. Giuseppe Marzorati as President starting December 1st, and Massimiliano Burelli has been appointed CEO to lead integration and growth plans.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali to construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali will build four photovoltaic plants in Sicily with over 20 MW capacity, enhancing energy performance and reducing environmental impact. This initiative aligns with their 2026–2029 Strategic Plan and supports regional decarbonisation efforts, strengthening their partnership with CVA.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has completed the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from Salzgitter for EUR 135 million, expanding its presence in seamless stainless steel and nickel alloy tubes. The acquisition supports Cogne's strategy to integrate upstream operations and enhance competitiveness in the stainless steel market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy, marking a step towards sustainable steel production. This initiative reflects the company's commitment to innovation and environmental responsibility in the specialty steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of energy used comes from renewable sources
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that 94% of its energy consumption is from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts. The report underscores the company's commitment to sustainability as a core corporate strategy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris to launch TenarisShawcor White Jacket™ coating at the Hydrogen and CCUS Technology World Expo
summary: Tenaris is unveiling its new TenarisShawcor White Jacket™ coating system at the Hydrogen and Carbon Capture Technology World Expo in Hamburg, Germany. The coating is designed for severe onshore and underground pipeline applications, offering enhanced mechanical strength and resistance for hydrogen and carbon capture transportation pipelines.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris recently hosted a panel in Italy on the future of nuclear energy and the Italian boilermaking industry, bringing together industry and institutional experts. The event highlighted Italy's potential role in Europe's nuclear energy transition and noted that Tenaris's Italian mill is now accredited to supply materials for nuclear facilities meeting ASME III standards.
